item.title: '100% Sure' Resident Evil Requiem Leaker Doubles Down on Leon Being the Main Character
item.description:
A leaker with a proven track-record insists that the main character of Resident Evil Requiem is Leon S. Kennedy. Resident Evil Requiem was first announced at the end of Summer Game Fest 2025, with the game seemingly revealing Grace Ashcroft as its protagonist. However, rumors and leaks have suggested that Capcom is pulling a fast one on fans, and that the true main character of Resident Evil Requiem will be none other than Leon Kennedy.

Leon has been a fan-favorite character among Resident Evil fans since he first appeared in Resident Evil 2 . Following Resident Evil 2 , Leon was the star of Resident Evil 4 , widely considered not only one of the best Resident Evil games, but one of the best video games ever made. Leon also appeared in Resident Evil 6 and the remakes of Resident Evil 2 and 4 , plus he has been featured in various canon CG movies.

At the recent Capcom Spotlight event, the Resident Evil Requiem Leon rumors were addressed by game director Koshi Nakanishi. Nakanishi explained that while the team considered the option of making Leon the main character of Resident Evil Requiem , they decided he wasn't a "good fit" for horror. Some took this to mean that Leon is not in the game, but leaker AestheticGamer/Dusk Golem has doubled down on their claims that the fan-favorite character is indeed Requiem 's main character. AestheticGamer said, "I'm 100% sure Leon is the protagonist still," pointing out that Requiem isn't going to be a "pure horror game" and claiming Capcom is "baiting you guys 100%."

Resident Evil Leaker Still Says Leon is the Main Character of Requiem

Resident Evil Requiem has previously been described as a blend of horror and "high-stakes cinematic action." Assuming the claims that Leon is the main character of Resident Evil Requiem are true, it seems that Grace Ashcroft will be playable for the more horror-focused sections that have been shown off so far, while Leon will star in the action-oriented sequences.

It's rare for game companies to acknowledge rumors. Capcom could have simply ignored the Leon rumors and made no mention of him at all, but the decision to address the claims could actually point to the rumors of him being Resident Evil Requiem 's main character being true. The same Capcom Spotlight saw the company address the Resident Evil Requiem open world rumors, which was also unexpected.

If Leon is in Resident Evil Requiem , fans should find out sooner rather than later. Resident Evil Requiem will be at Gamescom 2025 in August, plus the game's release date being in February means that information on it should come at a regular pace in the months ahead.

item.title: Death Stranding 2 Quality Mode Isn't Necessary
item.description:
The Quality mode in Death Stranding 2: On the Beach is largely unnecessary, according to a recent report from well-respected benchmarkers. Most Death Stranding 2 players are hence advised to go with the Performance mode, especially if they're playing the game on the PS5 Pro.

The follow-up to one of the most unusual open-world games in recent memory, Death Stranding 2 officially hit the market on June 26, following a brief early access period available to anyone who purchased one of its higher-tier editions. Like its predecessor, Kojima Productions' newly debuted title offers players a choice between Quality and Performance modes, which has been standard practice for AAA games since the eighth console generation.

The Death Stranding 2 graphics modes aren't created equal, according to a recent analysis by the benchmarking experts at Digital Foundry (via TheGamer), which characterizes the Quality preset as largely unnecessary. Although the base PS5 naturally makes a bit more compromises across every setting, it was still found to have no issues maintaining a stable frame rate across both modes: 30fps in Performance and 60fps in Quality.

Death Stranding 2's Performance Mode Trade-Offs Are Minimal

In terms of what looks different, the most noticeable visual trade-offs Digital Foundry identified were reduced anti-aliasing quality and minor sub-pixel instability—artifacts such as shimmering, flickering, or crawling caused by very fine visual details (small textures used for things like wires or cables) not aligning cleanly with the screen’s pixel grid. As expected, these issues were more prominent on the base model than on the more powerful PS5 Pro. The mid-gen refresh also averaged a slightly higher resolution than the base model’s 1440p, but since the resolution is dynamic, the improvement is challenging to quantify, especially since the overall difference is marginal.

Ultimately, while Quality mode offers a slight visual improvement on the base PS5, it's highly debatable whether the difference justifies sacrificing the responsiveness of 60 frames per second. On the PS5 Pro, the answer is a clear no: Death Stranding 2 's Quality mode looks nearly identical to Performance mode on Sony's most powerful console to date, rendering it largely unnecessary.

Death Stranding 2 Graphics Modes Comparison

Feature

Performance Mode

Quality Mode

Frame Rate (PS5)

60fps (stable)

30fps (stable)

Frame Rate (Pro)

60fps (stable)

30fps (stable)

Resolution (PS5)

1440p, some reconstruction artifacts

Slightly higher native res and cleaner image

Resolution (Pro)

Slightly above 1440p, less shimmer

Technically sharper than Performance Mode but barely noticeable difference

The redundancy of Quality mode on the more powerful console reflects Sony’s long-standing product messaging. Ever since the PS5 Pro's reveal in September 2024, Sony has maintained that its mid-gen refresh is for people who don't want to choose between quality and performance modes and are instead willing to pay for the fidelity of the former with the frame rate of the latter.

item.title: What Are Persona Seals & How To Use Them in Persona 5 Phantom X?
item.description:
Persona5: The Phantom X does have a protagonist who can use multiple Personas, and Personas are a major pull in the game's Gacha mechanic. Personas that are pulled can be equipped and used by Wonder, though getting a Persona can also give the player Persona Seals. Persona Seals don't act as actual Personas, and because of this, you won't lose any of your Personas whenever you fuse new ones.

Persona Seals have many uses even beyond fusion, and can be used in a few different ways to make Wonder a stronger option for your party. Here are all the ways to get Persona Seals and what they can be used for.

What are Persona Seals in Persona 5 X?

Persona Seals act as stand-ins for Personas, and aren't the actual Persona that Wonder equips. Whenever Wonder gets a Persona, it will be logged in the compendium, and subsequent Persona Seals act as duplicates for that Persona to be used in the Persona's place . You can stack as many Personas as you'd like, and a lot of uses for Persona Seals will require you to have more than just one. Persona Seals act as any other material you get in the game, with their only real connection to that Persona being the name. You can get Persona Seals by:

  • Pulling them through banners.
  • Defeating shadows in the Metaverse.
  • Challenge Reward exchange.
  • Metaverse Challenge Battles.

What are Persona Seals Used for in Persona 5 X

Persona Seals have four main uses:

Use Name

Explanation

Persona Fusion

Persona Fusion in the Velvet Room has a few different recipes depending on the Persona, all requiring various Persona Seals and differing amounts.

Teaching Skills

In the Velvet Room, use a Persona Seal to pass along skills from that Persona onto a different Persona.

Overclocking Personas

Persona Seals of that same Persona can be used to Overclock the Persona in the Velvet Room to boost its base stats.

Leveling Up Personas

Any Seal can be used to give XP to another Persona and help it level up.

How Should You Use Persona Seals?

It's highly recommended you never use Persona Seals to give XP to another Persona , as the amount of XP earned is not a lot, and Cubes offer a lot more XP. Persona Fusion should be your next top priority, just to fill out the Compendium and have every option. After that, you'll want to Overclock your better Personas, then teach skills here and there to round out your build for Wonder.

item.title: How to Unlock New Personas for Wonder in Persona 5: The Phantom X
item.description:
Each Phantom Thief in Persona 5: The Phantom X controls a Persona that has a range of elemental abilities that can weaken enemies. While each character has their own dedicated persona that they'll use in battle, Wonder is unique in the way that they can equip multiple personas and switch between them mid-battle. Having multiple Personas is essential in broadening the range of weaknesses Wonder can target, increasing the overall damage output of the party. So, here's how to unlock more Personas for Wonder in P5X .

How to Unlock More Personas for Wonder in Persona 5 Phantom X

There are several ways players can unlock new Personas to use with Wonder in P5: The Phantom X . Here are some of the best methods.

Some of the methods below will be locked until players progress through certain events in the story and level up Wonder.

  • Kiuchi's Palace : As part of the story, players will visit Kiuchi's Palace in the Metaverse to find his shadow. While exploring the castles, you'll encounter various shadow enemies to fight. After you win these battles, there's a slight chance for the Shadow to become part of Wonder's usable Personas.
  • Realm of Repression : Players can access the Persona tab of the Realm of Repression in the Metaverse, which lets them pick and choose which Personas to battle. Winning the fight will have a high chance of securing the Persona you've chosen to battle.
  • Gacha Pulls : Heading into the Contracts menu, trying to pull for either of the Phantom Idol banners will earn you multiple personas. If you received any dupes, they'll be converted to Clear Cognigems.

How to Switch & Upgrade Personas in P5X

Once you've unlocked multiple Personas for Wonder in P5X , head to the Velvet Room . Inside, select the Persona Training option, and select the Persona you want to level up. Select the upgrade materials required for leveling up, and confirm your choice. Personas will unlock new abilities as they level up, so make sure to periodically do so to maintain effectiveness in battle.

To switch Personas in P5X , in the same menu, click on Wonder's glasses icon in the top-right corner of the screen. This will open up a compendium of personas that you've accumulated so far. Here, you can select the Persona you want to equip on Wonder.

item.title: Grow a Garden Releases Big New Mega Summer Update
item.description:
Popular Roblox game Grow a Garden has officially dropped its "Mega Summer" update, introducing a variety of new plants, pets, and random events that players can find. The Roblox farming sim has rocketed into one of the most popular games on the massively popular game creation platform, boasting millions of players. The game offers a robust and deep farming system with a variety of things for players to do, from growing and protecting their crops to raising several different types of pets. Now, Grow a Garden is getting another big update.

Grow a Garden has introduced plenty to the game throughout recent months, keeping fans busy with lots of new content. The end of May saw Grow a Garden debut its "Bizzy Bees" update, adding bees and honey to the farming sim alongside new crops like Sunflowers and Nectarines. The update also welcomed an explosion in the game's player count, with more than 11 million players hopping on Roblox to try out the farming sim's new patch. A new update is now kicking off the summer with a plethora of content for Grow a Garden.

Grow A Garden Debuts "Mega Summer" Update

As reported by PCGamesN, Grow a Garden has officially rolled out its "Mega Summer" update with lots of new additions to the game. The update added "traveling merchants" to the game, appearing once every four hours for a 30-minute period and giving players access to exclusive items. Grow a Garden added eight different flowers to the update, including Rafflesias and Aloe Vera, alongside new pets like Fennec Foxes and Sand Snakes. The update even debuted several special events players can experience within Grow a Garden , like the Mega Harvest granting extra crops and an Aurora Borealis.

Grow a Garden 's big new update looks to bring lots to the table for fans of the farming sim, enticing players with special bonuses. Each of the three major new events feature special effects on the player's crops, with Tropical Rain and Aurora Borealis speeding up growth while Mega Harvests provide bonus Summer Harvest points. The two growth events are also said to contain their own special plant mutations, alongside new mutation sprays being added to the game.

The suite of changes coming to Grow a Garden comes as the game has already teased another update coming in less than two weeks. Alongside the release of Grow a Garden 's Mega Summer update, the team behind the farming sim also hinted at another content update set to arrive on July 5. No details were shared about what the next update would contain, though the patch will likely be smaller in scale than the sizable Mega Summer patch. Grow a Garden fans should have plenty of reasons to pop back into their farms with all the new content coming to the game.

Grow A Garden Mega Summer Update Patch Notes

Traveling Merchants

  • Can appear every 4 hours with purchasable stock that's available for 30 minutes. Each merchant (Sky/Gnome) sells their own distinct set of goods.

Plants

  • Pitcher Plant
  • Traveler's Fruit
  • Guanabana
  • Lily of the Valley
  • Aloe Vera
  • Rafflesia
  • Peace Lily
  • Delphinium

Pets

  • Fennec Fox
  • Hyacinth Macaw
  • Sand Snake
  • 3+ More

New Items

  • Oasis Egg, 5 possible new pets inside!
  • Magnifying Glass, inspect your own or other's fruit and see their value
  • Burnt Mutation Spray
  • Chilled Mutation Spray
  • Cloudtouched Mutation Spray
  • Oasis Crate, 7 possible summer cosmetics inside!
  • Iconic Gnome Crate, 5 possible classic gnomes inside!

Events

  • Mega Harvest: Has a 1 in 3 chance of occurring instead of a regular summer harvest event, gives 2x summer harvest points.
  • Aurora Borealis: Dancing lights that whisper through the northern night, 50% growth speed, chance to give the 'Aurora' Mutation
  • Tropical Rain: Warm rain falling gently, brightening fruit and earth. 50% growth speed, chance to give the 'Drenched' Mutation
  • Various new secret events
  • Various new secret mutations

Cosmetics

  • 6+ New Summer Cosmetics!

Fixes, Changes, and QOL

  • Items in your hotbar slots should now save
  • You can now toggle your inventory by favorite and non-favorited items
  • Changed the frozen mutation back to the original texture
  • Added Bee Egg to the Pet Eggs Shop
  • Removed various things from crafting
  • Reduced the crafting time for the Reclaimer gear
  • Likely fixed a bug causing fruits with lots of mutations to lose value and their weight
  • Made lots of performance optimizations & improvements
  • Added various sound settings to the settings UI
  • Fixed various UI scaling issues
  • & lots more!
